intro: Racosperma tessellatum, commonly known as the tessellated acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, flat, tessellated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, growing as a shrub or small tree. Racosperma tessellatum is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
